page.title: 20ATTITUDES
page.content: FEW PEOPLE IN THE AREA ARE OF ORIGINAL STOCK WHICH WERE YEOMAN FARMERS AND AGRICULTURAL WORKERS. NOW THEY ARE MAINLY PROPERTY OWNERS, HOUSES FARMS OR LAND. ALTHOUGH MANY HAVE COME FROM OTHER AREAS AND LEAVE TO WORK THE COMMUNITIES ARE MORE ISOLATED THAN IN FORMER TIMES WHEN FERRIES PLIED AND RIVER TRANSPORT PREVAILED. THOUGH A BRIDGE TO REPLACE THE FERRY BETWEEN THE MONKTONS WAS PROPOSED IN 1947 IT WAS NEVER BUILT.MOST FAMILIES OWN CARS. PRIVATE CONTACTS ARE THEREFORE SIMPLE WHILST THE VILLAGES REMAIN ISOLATED CUL-DE-SACS. DURING WORKING HOURS THEY APPEAR DESERTED SPECIALLY MOOR MONKTON WHICH HAS NO SCHOOL. THEY ARE DEVELOPING INTO DORMITORY VILLAGES THOUGH OLD FOOT-PATHS AND BRIDLE-PATHS EXIST RIGHTS OF WAY ARE OFTEN UNDER DISPUTE. THE INHABITANTS APPEAR TO ENJOY THE QUIET LIFE.
